newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late rubber steady on rains.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late rubber steady on rains.

text.p: Indonesian benchmark SIR20 offer prices were steady in late trading on Wednesday, as sentiment was firm on talk of lower supply due to rains, dealers said.

Dealers said SIR20 offer prices for October/November deliveries remained at 57.25-57.75 U.S. cents/lb fob Medan and 57.00-57.50 cents fob Palembang, Surabaya and Padang, and at 56.75-57.25 cents fob Jambi and Pontianak.
There were enquiries from Singapore-based dealers and European firms which could lead to deals later in the day, they said.
"Sentiment stays firm on talk of lower supply due to rains in many parts of Sumatra," one dealer in Jakarta said.
SIR20 fob October/November deliveries was last traded at 57.00-57.25 cents/lb in Medan and Palembang late on Tuesday.
Dealers said there were no fresh latex deals heard.
High amoniac latex was on offer at 2,260 rupiah/kg in Tangerang and Bandung against the previous 2,350 rupiah due to weak demand. -- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
